regretList.regret: The most vivid one - it takes a second to remember - is betraying my best friends expectations.
Not completing college.
Not pushing myself enough
I wish that I´d return back to my country after my relationship broke up and took back my life there. I wish, I´d ask for help sooner and wasn´t judging myself for it.
Letting thoughts of the past cloud my present and future.

Mi abuelo pasó mucho tiempo conmigo cuando fui pequeño. Mucho de lo que se lo aprendí con el y de el. El se murió con 90 años cuando yo tenía 24... y con el tiempo me di cuenta que tenía que haberle acompañado en sus últimos años como el hizo conmigo en mis primeros años... no lo hice por que no fui consciente...

Tambien me hubiera gustado aprovechar más la época de los 15 a los 30 años... me divertí mucho... y podía además de divertirme haber aprovechado más para aprender y tener experiencias, viajes, etc...
Not dating the first girl who said she had a crush on me
I regret not asking "her" out back then,
regret not dating many people before getting married
I got a slow start to planning my financial future, and it's been hard to catch up.
I didn't treat women with respect when I was in university.

Not taking Cantonese seriously earlier on. While I was born and raised in Hong Kong, my younger self didn't identify with the language and thus did not care to be fluent at it. My parents immigrated here and while I can get by with English, there are definitely a lot of missed opportunities due to language barrier.
Not being brave enough to say what needed to be said for fear of being unkind. Failing to recognise that I was being unkind in that moment.
I don't like what I do. If I had the chance I change my career. I don't like to live in Lisbon if I was that my life in Lisbon will be so bad I'll change a different city to live.
I regret bullying someone when I was in elementary school.

Tengo muchos remordimientos o arrepentimientos, pero al querer escribirlos se me vinieron a la mente acontecimientos maravillosos que la vida me ha regalado en lugar de aquellos. Entonces dejo de verlos como remordimientos y agradezco a Dios y a la vida que las cosas fueran tal y como se han dado y me doy cuenta de que aquello es una quimera y esto, mi realidad.

I regret being a pushover. Until very recently I allowed everyone and anyone to take advantage of me. This behavior kept me in an abusive marriage for nearly 20 years. I regret not standing up for myself sooner, taking control of my life, and striving for the things that bring me joy. Thankfully, I'm doing those things now.
Letting love slip away
I regret not traveling all around the world in my twenties and thirties
Not following my true career choice of teaching.
Not getting out of my comfort zone

Regret: Attending 3 different colleges (due to unfortunate circumstances) to get my bachelors of fine art degree rather than staying at one for 4 years. I missed out on building stronger relationships and connections.

About 25 years ago I had an opportunity to take a 2 year job assignment in Europe (I live in the USA) but decided not to go because my romantic partner didn't want me to leave. I missed out on what could have been a great challenge. That was one of the dumbest decisions I have ever made. (Getting involved with that romantic partner was also a regrettable choice.)
I regret that I did not stay focused on being an engaged husband early in my marriage. While we are still together and get along, we much closer to being roommates than lovers.

I regret wearing a provocative outfit years ago. I wear decent clothing almost always now. But looking back, i feel disgusted by my behavior, and i wish i could take it back. But live and learn right?
Stop working at 30ty and now I'm 45 and still "have never begun", but have a great desire to realise myself. Feel great energy to do smth huge, but can't find - what and where it can be.
I regret to not have been more open and approaching towards my extended family to have a closer relationship with them.
put my child in private school not public ....he would have had an easier time growing up I think
Taking opportunities to practice public speaking
